text:
Hey all. Every now and then I find myself thinking about HubSpot's image optimisation and what it does and doesn't do. In the below video (~1 year old), Kevin, who surely knows his stuff, recommends using smart rules to serve optimised images to mobile users to improve site speed. But shouldn't HubSpot's built in image optimisation do that automatically - optimising performance as long as the original image is compressed and sized appropriately? And wouldn't adding a smart rule to do this negatively impact page load speed by bypassing the edge-cached version?
<https://youtu.be/uNDkycrG6og?si=PH2mdah0hH0BNzK5&t=187>

Activity Associations:
Might be really simple, does anyone know how to change the default associations on activities such as notes, calls logged etc?
Previously it just associates to the object the activity is on, but it has now defaulted to the object + any associated contacts, companies, deals... and so on. It can be unticked individually but this isn't really a good fix. Pending an absolute meltdown here on a database with over 30k contacts + a similar number of deals, companies etc... :melting_face:

Edited to add: I have submitted a support ticket with HS directly, as live chat unavailable. Hoping it's just a simple setting somewhere I cannot find - the main issue is on deals as previously notes and calls were logged on a deal only, and we do not want them logged on associated company (we have companies with hundreds/thousands of deals associated to them).

We want the HubSpot Developer community to be inclusive and welcoming. By following our Code of Conduct, you can help ensure that's the case.

TL;DR:
• Be respectful
• Be inclusive (try not to say, "Hey guys, hey boys, hey [any specific group]")
• No self promotion, except for <#C0121KGC6RM|showcase> and <#CBNDYJJAZ|jobs> 
• No unsolicited DMs
Read the <https://developers.HubSpot.com/slack/code-of-conduct|whole thing here> - and thanks for being a part of the HubSpot Developer Community!

Want to report a violation? DM <@UQNEXHW14> or fill out the <https://form.asana.com/?k=p7aM0fpd3G4JGETDL_nYXg&d=8587152060687|anonymous form here>.

Yeah smart content breaks caching. I wouldn’t recommend this way.

Build your modules in a way that either leverages HubSpot’s auto resizing (good), fine tune it with the `resize_image_url()` function (better), or even provides a mobile image field for `picture` elements (best)
I assume Kevin does this in his updated products (that video is old in HubSpot years). He makes cool stuff
Hi All...Need documentation on creating ISR activity report inside HubSpot. could you please someone provide the details
I signed up for the new source property but it looks like there's 3 new ones for every object, anyone know why this is?
anyone here familiar with webhook validation, especially in node js. There seems to be something wrong with my validation because I'm not getting the same signature as the one being provided

Created a email signature utilizing this image : <https://22280705.fs1.HubSpotusercontent-na1.net/hubfs/22280705/Kissflow_vertical_black-01%201.png>
Since the domain got down. I would like to redirect this into another image URL. How to achieve this !
